meanings.definition: To change the course of a sailing vessel by hauling in the jib sheet to bring the bow through the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailors had to boxhaul to navigate around the storm.
meanings.sent2: The captain decided to boxhaul to avoid the rocky shore.
meanings.sent3: Trying to boxhaul in a calm sea made the crew laugh.
meanings.sent4: She had to boxhaul her emotions to stay focused.
meanings.sent5: The decision to boxhaul the ship was swift and decisive.

meanings.definition: A maneuver in sailing in which a vessel changes course by hauling in the jib sheet to bring the bow through the wind.
meanings.sent1: The boxhaul was necessary to avoid a collision.
meanings.sent2: During the race, the sailors executed a perfect boxhaul.
meanings.sent3: The boxhaul in the regatta was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The boxhaul of the ship was a graceful dance on the water.
meanings.sent5: The boxhaul maneuver was the highlight of the sailing trip.
